resolutions.for: Elected player gains a victory point (at end of round)
Each leader now possesses the abilities of all Leader types. When executing Leaders, players must exhaust of lose control of two additional planets.
resolutions.against: Each player may immediately roll a Fate Roll for each of their Leaders in captivity or put one Killed Leader back into play at a friendly planet.

resolutions.for: All current laws are discarded. Each player must choose and exhaust two of his planets if able.
resolutions.against: The player with the most votes against this agenda may choose and discard one law.

resolutions.for: Immediately place 1 Space Mine (not belonging to any player) on each border of the Mecatol Rex system.
resolutions.against: Each player may spend 2 influence to place neutral Space Mines (not belonging to any player) on any two borders.

resolutions.for: No player may have more Trade Goods (in the Trade Goods area) than the total number of planets he controls.
resolutions.against: Each player without any Trade Goods immediately receives 2 Trade Goods.

resolutions.for: The player(s) with the least resources worth of ships gain 4 Trade Goods. The player with fewer Victory Points than any other player gains 4 Trade Goods.
resolutions.against: For the remainder of the round, any player conducting a hostile action against the player(s) with the (at the time) most inferior fleet or the fewest Victory Points must exhaust or lose control of a planet.

resolutions.for: Each player must discard one Trade Good for each planet he controls.
resolutions.against: The player with the most votes against this agenda must discard one Trade Good.

resolutions.for: The player(s) with the lowest Fleet Supply at the beginning of each Status Phase gain 1 additional Command Counter during that Status Phase.
resolutions.against: The player(s) with the lowest Fleet Supply immediately gain 3 Trade Goods.

resolutions.for: Space Docks may be built on planets aquired the same round.
resolutions.against: Each player must lose 3 Trade Goods or immediately destroy one of his Space Docks.

resolutions.for: The secondary ability of the Technology Strategy may not be executed this round (even by the card holder).
resolutions.against: Exhaust planets with technology specialties. Blue technologies may not be used for the remainder of this round.

resolutions.for: Each time a player executes the secondary ability of the Trade Strategy he may also take one Trade Good from an opponent's Trade Goods area or active Trade Agreement.
resolutions.against: Players must discard one Trade Good (if able).

resolutions.for: Each player gains the Warsun technology, regardless of prerequisites. When a fighter rolls a natural 10 as a combat roll the resulting hit must be assigned to a Warsun (if able).
resolutions.against: Red and yellow technologies may not be aquired this round.

resolutions.for: Technology of the elected color may not be aquired.
The elected player may execute the secondary ability of the Technology Strategy without paying a Command Counter from his Strategy Allocation. His cost to purchase technologies is reduced by 1.
All players must exhaust all planets. Mecatol Rex gains 2 Refineries and 3 Colonies.
resolutions.against: Exhaust Mecatol Rex and remove 1 ground unit from the planet. If no ground units remains on Mecatol Rex, it reverts to neutral status.

resolutions.for: Choosing Strategy Cards is done is order of highest to lowest total influence. When picking a Strategy Card it may be given to any player that has not yet received a Strategy Card.
resolutions.against: All Strategy Cards are immediately exhausted (turned to their inactive side without being executed).

resolutions.for: Space Mines now cost 1 resource each and are deployed as neutral mines. Space Mines can no longer be deployed on wormholes.
resolutions.against: Turn all Space Mines on the board neutral.

resolutions.for: After current agendas have been resolved, the player who placed most votes for this agenda receives +3 votes for the rest of the round, and may choose an active law. Conduct a new round of voting on the chosen law (replenishing total votes).
resolutions.against: Reveal one Stage I Public Objective.

resolutions.for: The elected player may, immediately following the secondaries of Assembly, take two consecutive tactical actions. The Command Counter used for these actions are paid from reinforcements.
The player who controls Mecatol Rex may immediately choose and discard one current law, or play an agenda from his hand and immediately choose the outcome (count as 10 votes).
resolutions.against: The player who controls Mecatol Rex may place one Armor (MU) or one PDS on Mecatol Rex.

resolutions.for: Technologies are now paid with influence instead of resources. Players may never benefit from more than 2 Technology discounts per Technology purchased.
resolutions.against: Technology aquired this round have no effect for the remainder of the round.

resolutions.for: The elected player receives 1 Victory Point. Whenever another player wins a Space Battle or Invasion Combat against this player, that player receives 1 Trade Good.

Each player that has already completed the elected Public Objective receives 1 Victory Point. Players that fulfill the elected objective in the future receive one more Victory Point than stated on the Public Objective.
Remove all Command Counters from the elected system, exhaust planets and Space Docks in the system.

The owner of the elected fleet must remove half the nunber (round down) of each ship type in the fleet (including Fighters). The owner gains Trade Goods equal to the resource value of all the removed non-Fighter ships.
Each player shuffles his Secret Objective back into the deck. Each player is then dealt a new Secret Objective (even if he already completed one).
resolutions.against: Each player that has completed his Secret Objective receives 1 Victory Point.

resolutions.for: For the remainder of the round, the player(s) with the most planets outside their Home System (at the time the action is done) must pay one additional Command Counter from his Command Pool to conduct tactical actions.
resolutions.against: The player(s) with the least planets outside their Home System receives one Command Counter.

resolutions.for: Each fleet must be reduced immediately to no more than 10 ships and no more than 15 resources worth of non-Fighter ships. Each army must be reduced immediately to no more than 8 ground units. Exhaust all Space Docks.
resolutions.against: All planets with red technology specialties are immediately exhausted.

resolutions.for: Each player that voted for this agenda gains 1 Victory Point.
resolutions.against: Each player that voted for this agenda loses 1 Victory Point.

resolutions.for: Give this card to the elected player. After agendas have been chosen by the Assembly holder, the elected player may discard one of them and then discard this card. The Assembly resumes without the discarded agenda.
Whenever you participate in a Space Battle or Invasion Combat you gain 1 Trade Good.
resolutions.against: Remove flags from Public Objectives not related to Technology, but retain the Victory Points. The objectives may now be claimed normally again.

resolutions.for: Exhaust all planets. No secondary abilities may be used for the remainder of this round.
resolutions.against: Players may refresh up to three planets each.

resolutions.for: Each elected player must give his unclaimed Secret Objective card to the other elected player (if able).
From now on, any player that fulfills his Secret Objective receives 1 addtional Victory Point.
resolutions.against: Each player that has already fulfilled his Secret Objective receives 1 Victory Point.

resolutions.for: Each player may pay 2 resources to place up to 2 Destroyers and 1 Cruiser in systems containing friendly planets or units.
resolutions.against: The cost of all (non-Fighter) ships is increased by 1 resource until the end of the round.

resolutions.for: During Assembly, after votes have been revealed, players may spend resources to place one additional vote per resource spent (players may continue to spend resources this way in no particular order).
resolutions.against: Refresh all non-Home System planets with influence value higher than resource value.

resolutions.for: The elected player gains 1 Trade Good at the end of each turn in which at least one player took control of a neutral planet, or moved ships into or through a red bordered system (asteroid belts and other border tokens do not count).

Elect player with two active Trade Agreements. The elected player must break one of his Trade Agreements. All Trade Goods on both affected Trade Contracts are collected by respective players trade partner. No new Trade Agreements may be formed by the elected player this round.
The resource cost to purchase ground units is twice the indicated value.
resolutions.against: No players may place one Ground Force on each planet they control.

resolutions.for: Whenever moving one or more ships through an Asteroid Field, gain 1 Trade Good.
resolutions.against: Asteroid Fields may not be traversed for the remainder of the round. Everyone that voted for this agenda must discard 1 Trade Good.

resolutions.for: The elected player may, after an Action Card has been played, pay 4 influence to cancel the effect and discard the Action Card instead. Count it as if the Action Card had not been played.
Discard the elected law.
Place a (neutral) Space Mine on the elected border (this border may not be a wormhole). When the Space Mine token is triggered and removed, immediately place another one.

At the start of every round, the elected player receives three Trade Goods. Every time a player wins a Space Battle or Invasion Combat against the elected player, this player may take one of the elected player's Trade Goods.
For the next round, no player may engage in Invasion Combat against the elected player.
The first player to destroy a Space Dock belonging to the elected player as a result of either Space Battle or Invasion Combat receives 1 Victory Point. Then discard this card.
The resource value of planets are no longer added to the production capacity of Space Docks.
resolutions.against: No Space Docks may produce units for the remainder of this round.

resolutions.for: Ion Storms and Nebulas no longer have an effect on ship movement.
resolutions.against: No Special Systems (red-bordered) may be entered for the remainder of this round.

resolutions.for: Divide the total votes for this agenda by 5. Each player may place that number of Ground Force units on planets he controls.
resolutions.against: No player may purchase Ground Force units for the remainder of this round.

resolutions.for: The first player to win a Space Battle as the attacker against the elected player gains 2 Trade Goods, 1 Command Counter, and 1 Action Card. Then discard this card.
Each player gains 4 Trade Goods for each Nebula and/or Ion Storm system he controls.
resolutions.against: Conduct the effect of Space Mines against each fleet in a Nebula or Ion Storm system. Place 4 Trade Goods on each of these systems; these work exactly like Natural Wealth, except that they are claimed by the owner of ships in the system.

resolutions.for: Give this card to the current Speaker. As an action, he may discard this card to invoke (treat as 10 votes) the prefered outcome of a Political Card in his hand.
The cost of all Technologies of the elected color is decreased by three. The cost of all other Technology is increased by two.
The elected player may immediately place a free Spade Dock on any planet he controls, even if it was aquired this round. The Space Dock starts exhausted.
Each player may immediately aquire on Technology held by one of their trade partners, regardless of prerequisites.
resolutions.against: All Trade Agreements are immediately broken.

resolutions.for: Give this card to the elected player. The elected player may take 1 Trade Good from up to two different players after the secondary ability of the Trade Strategy has been conducted. During the Status Phase, he may now produce Trade Goods fom influence at a 1:1 ratio.
Amor (MU) and PDS units now cost 1 resource and one production capacity to produce.
resolutions.against: Players voting against this agenda may upgrade 2 Ground Forces to Shock Troops.

resolutions.for: The unmodified (printed) influence and resource value of all planets are swapped.
resolutions.against: Each player must exhaust all but one of his Space Docks.

resolutions.for: Elect an existing law that was in effect at the beginning of the round. After current agendas are resolved, conduct a new round of voting on the elected law (with replenished votes).
In order to execute a planetary landing on a neutral planet, player must spend influence at least equal to the resource value of the planet.
resolutions.against: All players must immediately exhaust one planet of their choice for every three planets they control outside their Home-Systems (round down), if able.

resolutions.for: Give this card to the elected player. Whenever any player activates Mecatol Rex, the elected player may discard this card to immediately inflict up to four hits on an army present on Mecatol Rex.
Players may, at the start of their turn, spend 10 influence to discard an active law. Opponents may then cancel this effect by immediately spending 6 influence.
resolutions.against: The player with the most planets outside his Home System may discard one active law.

resolutions.for: The player controlling Hope's End may immediately place 1 Ground Force and 2 Shock Troops there.
resolutions.against: Refresh Hope's End.

resolutions.for: Each player may draw one Action Card. Then the player with the most votes for this agenda may draw one more.
resolutions.against: Each player must immediately discard two random Action Cards.

resolutions.for: Place 3 Trade Goods, treated like Natural Wealth, on each planet in systems adjacent to either Asteroid Fields or Asteroid Belts.
resolutions.against: Each player discards 2 Trade Goods from Trade Goods area, if able.

resolutions.for: The player with the most votes for this agenda may take one random Action Card from up to three opponents. Then the player with the second most votes for this agenda may take one random Action Card from one opponent.
resolutions.against: Players that voted for this agenda must discard all but one of their Action Cards.

resolutions.for: This planet always yields votes, even if exhausted. It gains one additional Technology specialty of each of the four colors. When the owner executes the secondary ability of the Technology strategy, he may purchase and extra Technology.
For each Assembly, the holder must include one agenda from the discard pile (in addition to the normal options). After the Assembly, place it on the bottom of the Political deck instead.
resolutions.against: Shuffle the discard pile back into the Political deck.

resolutions.for: Place the indicated number of Trade Goods on each active Trade Agreements.
resolutions.against: All players must discard half (round up) of their Trade Goods.

resolutions.for: There are no longer different types of carrying capacity; Fighter capacity and Ground Force capacity becomes regular capacity.
resolutions.against: No cargo may be picked up for the remainder of this round.

resolutions.for: Give this card to the elected player. The elected player may discard this card immediately after an "Elect" agenda is chosen for voting. Only the elected player's votes are counted in resolving the agenda.
Players may not conduct Invasion Combat (or bombardment) against Mecatol Rex.
resolutions.against: Mecatol Rex is the only planet players may invade this round.

resolutions.for: Obtain any amount of the following bonuses by placing the required number of votes: Trade Good: 2 votes. Command Counter: 4 votes. Victory Point: 10 votes.
Player must play with their Action Cards and Political Cards face-up and visible to all players. (Yssaril may keep 1 Action Card secret).
resolutions.against: The player (or players) with the fewest Action Cards immediately draws 1 Action Card and 1 Political Card.

resolutions.for: Roll a die. On a 1 to 5 all units in the Mecatol Rex system are destroyed, Mecatol Rex turns neutral, and each fleet and planet in adjacent systems sustains two combat rolls with value of 5 (treated as bombardment against the planets). On a 6 to 10, each player gains two Technologies of choice for which they have the required prerequisites.
resolutions.against: Discard this card.

resolutions.for: All Trade Agreements in the game now have a value of 2.
resolutions.against: Each player immediately loses 2 Trade Goods.

resolutions.for: Replace elected empty system tile with a random unused planetary system tile. Domain Counters present in the system are discarded.

The elected player may spend a Command Counter from his Strategy Allocation area to gain two automatic hits before the first round of Space Battle in which he participates, or as part of bombardment. These hits are applied immediately, with no return with allowed by the casualties taken.
Whenever players has more ground units on a planet than the number of Command Counters in their fleet supply, they must remove excess ground units.
resolutions.against: Each player must exhaust two planets (if able).

resolutions.for: Wormholes of all types are now considered adjacent (for movement purposes) to all other wormholes.
resolutions.against: No units may enter or leave the Wormhole Nexus for the rest of the round.

resolutions.for: The elected players must either exhaust or lose control of two planets when being the aggressor in a Space Battle or Invasion Combat against the other elected player. Then discard this law.
In order to produce units in a system, the active player must first spend 1 influence.
resolutions.against: Each player must immediately discard one Command Counter from his Command Pool or Strategy Allocation, if able.

resolutions.for: Each player receives one Victory Point.
resolutions.against: The player(s) with the most Victory Points gain(s) one Command Counter.

resolutions.for: Players may not re-distribute Command Counters during the Status Phase.
resolutions.against: Draw and put into play one Public Stage I Objective.

resolutions.for: No player may activate any system that contains enemy ships or invade any planet controlled by another player next round. Any player may spend 10 influence at any time to discard this effect.
resolutions.against: Each player who voted against this agenda must exhaust one planet. The planet is chosen by the opponent to that player's left.

resolutions.for: Space Docks gain the space cannon and planetary shield abilities (as if it was a PDS unit).
resolutions.against: Refresh all exhausted Space Docks.

resolutions.for: Players may place one Ground Force and one PDS unit on each planet they control that is closer to (including shortest route through wormholes) an enemy Home System than their own.
resolutions.against: Exhaust these planets.

resolutions.for: The elected player's Fighters receive +2 to all combat rolls when attacking and +1 when defending. After this round, the elected player must conduct (be the attacker) at least one Space Battle every round or discard this law.

The elected player's ground units now receive +2 to all combat rolls when attacking and +1 when defending. The elected player must conduct at least one Invasion Combat every round (after this round), or discard this law.
The special abilities of this system is now ignored. Players may activate and travel into and through the system as if it were an empty system. Fleets in this system do not block movement.
When purchasing Technology, you may treat it as being another color for (for the purposes of discounts from Technology specialties).
resolutions.against: Exhaust all planets with Technology specialties.

resolutions.for: Givet his card to the elected player. He may discard this card at any time to cancel a fleet's movement into a system containing an enemy fleet, as long as the elected player controls neither fleet. The target system is still activated by the attacker.
The elected player receives one additional Action Card each Status Phase.

When a player uses the secondary ability of the Technology Strategy, reduce his cost to 0 if he is purchasing the same Technology aquired as the player using the primary ability (pre-prequisites are still required).
resolutions.against: Exhaust each planet that has a Technology specialty.

resolutions.for: The elected player may draw one Secret Objective card. This may be claimed in addition to his existing Secret Objective, but not in the same round. When an ability affects his Secret Objective and he has two in his hand, he choses which one it affects.
Players may, during the Status Phase, discard one of their Technologies in exchange for 5 Trade Goods, even if it is a pre-requisite for another Technology.
resolutions.against: Players may discard one Technology to receive one which they currently hold the pre-requisites for.

resolutions.for: The elected player loses all Action Cards, his planets are exhausted, and his units receive -1 to all combat rolls for the remainder of this round.

Immediately place 2 Trade Goods on this card, and an additonal three during every Status Phase. The elected player may, as an action, discard this law and collect the Trade Goods present on this card.
Players do not have to adhere to fleet supply limits during the Action Phase. At the start of the Status Phase, players must remove any ships in excess of fleet supply.
resolutions.against: Each player must immediately discard one Command Counter from his fleet supply.

resolutions.for: In rotation order, players may immediately execute the secondary abilities of their respective Strategy cards (in any order if they have more than one), without spending Command Counters.
resolutions.against: No player may execute the secondary ability of any Strategy card for the remainder of this round.

resolutions.for: While this law is in play, the elected player gains 2 Victory Points.

No ships may traverse the borders of this system during the next round of play. If this system gained at least 12 votes more than any other system, the quarentine will take effect immediately (and last throughout next round).

Place the flags of the elected players on this law. The elected players cannot have Trade Agreements with other while this law is in play. If they have a Trade Agreement already, it is immediately broken.
Upkeep is paid for each Fleet Supply exceeding 4 (instead of 8).
resolutions.against: Each player receives one Command Counter from his reinforcements and must place it in his Fleet Supply area.

resolutions.for: Destroy all units on the planets receiving the most votes (beloning to two different players). The two planets revert to neutral status. Neither Mecatol Rex nor Home System planets may be elected.
This planet provide votes even when exhausted, but may not produce units.
Each player must immediately scuttle units so that the total combined resource value of all his units do not exceed 25. All players that that voted for this agenda receive one Action Card.
resolutions.against: All players that voted for this agenda gain +2 to all combat rolls for the remainder of this round.

resolutions.for: Place a Colony on every planet in the elected system, along with 3 Trade Goods (that work as Natural Wealth). Then refresh those planets. This system may not be activated by any player for the remainder of this round.
Each player must scuttle two of their non-Fighter ships and half of their Fighters (round down).
resolutions.against: Discard all but one of the Trade Goods currently present in the Trade Agreements and Trade Goods areas.

resolutions.for: The elected planet immediately gains a Colony. While this law is active, the player controlling this planet gains 1 victory point (but loses it when losing control of the planet).
In order to move through wormholes, ships must start their movement on the entry wormhole and end their movement at the exit wormhole. Wormholes may not be used during secondary of Warfare.
resolutions.against: Players must scuttle 1 non-Fighter ship from earch of their fleets in systems containing wormholes.

resolutions.for: Whitdrawals and retreats may not be called during the first round of combat. The player with the most combat dice during each combat round may not roll more combat dice than the opponent (but may choose which ones to roll).
resolutions.against: For the remainted of the round, all tactical retreats and withdrawals are free.

resolutions.for: The player(s) with the most non-Home System planets must choose one of their planets and destroy all units on that planet. The player with the fewest non-Home System planets (Speaker breaks tie) may then place two free Ground Forces on affected planets and assume control over it.
resolutions.against: Discard this card.

resolutions.for: All ground units on this planet are destroyed, but the planet's controller recieves twice the cost of each destroyed unit as Trade Goods. The controller retains control of the planet.

Players that voted for this agenda may immediately purchase Ground Forces for 0.5 influence each, and place them at planets they control. No more than three Ground Forces may be placed on each planet.
resolutions.against: Everyone that voted for this agenda must exgaust a planet, if able.

resolutions.for: Planets that contain Space Dock may not be bombarded.
resolutions.against: Each played that voted against this law must immediately exhaust one of his Space Docks outside his Home System.

resolutions.for: During each Status Phase, all normally recieved Action Cards are drawn and placed face up on the table. The player with the highest total influence may choose his action Cards first, followed by the played with the second-most total influence, etc.
resolutions.against: No Action Cards are drawn during this Status Phase.

resolutions.for: All players may, in normal order starting with the Speaker, conduct a free Tactical Action by activating their Home System (even if the system is already activated, but then Space Docks are immediately exhausted). In the movement step, all units (even in activated systems) gain sufficient and independent movement range to their respective Home Systems.
resolutions.against: Exhaust Home System planets.

resolutions.for: Units no longer lose combat dice when using the sustain damage ability.
resolutions.against: Immediately repair all damaged units.

resolutions.for: The elected player recieves one Trade Good from the Trade Goods area of each opponent (if able), and may also add 1 Trade Good to each of his active Trade Agreements.
Fighter units now cost 1 resource each.
resolutions.against: Each player must immediately scuttle all but 10 of his fighter units.

title: Fleet Restrictions (LAW)

resolutions.for: Fleets may not contain more than 3 of a single ship type (including Fighters).
resolutions.against: For each system where a player has with more than 3 ships of the same type, the owner must pay 1 Trade Good or destroy all excess ships.

comment: Var troligtvis felskriven i SA, la till more och where på rätt ställen.

resolutions.for: When the Trade Strategy is played, players may either be exemp from paying a Command Counter for the secondary ability, or place 1 extra Trade Good on each of their active Trade Agreements.
resolutions.against: All players must discard two Trade Goods from their Trade Goods area.

resolutions.for: The elected Dreadnought now has a base movement of 2 (but is not modified by Admirals), 1 extra sustain damage and +2 capacity. During each Status Phase, the owner may place 1 Shock Troop on this ship (if able).
The player controlling Hope's End may immediately place 1 Ground Force and 2 Shock Troops there.
resolutions.against: Refresh Hope's End.

resolutions.for: Each player gains 3 Trade Goods for eadch system he controls containing at least one wormhole*. Add 1 Trade Goods to all active Trade Agreements.
resolutions.against: Discard 3 Trade Goods present on each active Trade Agreements, if able

resolutions.for: Cancel the effects of all other agendas in this round of voring. Openly draw as many Political Cards as there are players. The player with the most votes for this agenda may then choose one of the drawn agendas and choose the outcome (count as 10 votes). Then the player with the second most votes may do the same, and so on until all players with votes on this agenda has chosen one outcome.
resolutions.against: Discard this card.

resolutions.for: The maximum hand-size of Action Cards is reduced to 3 (except for Yssaril).
resolutions.against: All players must discard one random Action Card, if able.

resolutions.for: The player who controls Mecatol Rex gains 1 victory point. He must then immediately move all ships from his Home System to Mecatol Rex (ships in excess of Fleet Supply are destroyed).
resolutions.against: Exhaust Mecatol Rex.

resolutions.for: The elcted planet now has 0 influence (law). Place a Refinery and 10 Trade Goods on the planet, treated like Natural Wealth. Remove three Ground Forces and one PDS unit from the planet, if able.

title: Media War (LAW)

resolutions.for: In order for unexhausted planets to yield votes during Assembly, the owner must choose and exhaust them prior to revealing votes.*
resolutions.against: Each player may spend influence to gain 1 Trade Good per influence spent.

comment: *Winnu (planet) must also be exhausted in order to yield votes, but provides votes even if it was exhausted from before.

resolutions.for: The elcted player may spend a Command Counter from his Strategy Allocation area to gain two automatic hits before the first round of any Space Battle in which he participates, or as part of bombardement. These hits are applied immediately, with no return fire allowed by the casualties taken.
The elcted player recieves 2 Trade Goods whenever a Space Dock is built. The elected player does not have to pay a Command Counter to use the secondary ability of the Production Strategy.

At the start of each Strategy Phase, you may choose on Technology (that you did not choose last round) held by another player, and then choose either effect a) or b) for the remainted of the round: a) you may also utilize its effect b) no player may use its effect

title: Necessary Bureaucracy (LAW)

resolutions.for: Instead of claming an objective as part of the primary ability of the Bureacracy Strategy Card, the holder may remove a flag from a claimed Objective* and retain the victory point. This Objective may now be claimed again.
resolutions.against: Exhaust Mecatol Rex.

comment: *Objectives related to holding Technology Advances may not be chosen

resolutions.for: In order to activate a system that contain enemy units, players must spend 2 influence.
resolutions.against: Each player must place a Command Counter from his reinforcements onto one of his unactivated systems containing a Space Dock (if able).

resolutions.for: The elctedf player may not execute invasions (or bombardements), or execute the secondary ability of any Strategy Card this round. He may also not place Trade Goods on his Trade Agreements for the remainder of the round.
Each time a player takes control of a neutral planet, he may place one Ground Force on that planet.
resolutions.against: No player may execute a plantery landing on a neutral planet for the remainder of this round.

resolutions.for: Turn the elected planet neutral (and remove all units). The player with the most votes on this planet may then place one Ground Force and claim the planet exhausted, and take one random Action Card from the previous owner.
For each planet without ground units, the controller may place 1 Ground Force there.
resolutions.against: Non-Home System planets containing no ground units immediately revert to neutral status.

resolutions.for: When a player chooses the Assembly Strategy Card, he immediately gains 1 Command Counter or 2 Trade Goods.
resolutions.against: At the end of this round of Assembly, draw the top card of the Political Deck and immediately resolve its agenda (conduct a new round of voting with replenished votes).

resolutions.for: Remove all Control Markers from the elected Objective. Players who have already fulfilled the elcted Objective may fulfill it again. Those players do not lose any points, and must follow normal rules when fulfilling the Objective again.
When a player fires a PDS (space cannon) at an opposing fleet, Trade Agreements are broken as if a Space Battle was initiated by the players using the Space Cannon ability.
resolutions.against: Players may not use their PDS units this turn, except to defend during planetary invasions.

resolutions.for: The base cost for Technologies purchased through the secondary ability of the Technology Strategy Card increases to 7. Playerrs who do not execute any abilities of the Technology Card may instead draw one Action Card.
resolutions.against: All players must immediately discard one Action Card, if able.

resolutions.for: While controlling enemy Home Systems, gain one victory point for each.
resolutions.against: Players must immediately move all their fleets in enemy Home Systems to their own Home System (ships in excess of Fleet Supply are scuttled immediately). If enemy ships are present, conduct a Space Battle.

resolutions.for: The elected player immediately recieves 5 Trade Goods.

After this Action PHase, conduct Invsaion Combats with 2 attaching Ground Forces against planets situated in activated systems. If the attackers win, the planet turns neutral and gains Hostile Locals of strength 2 on  it.
resolutions.against: Skip the next "refresh planets" step during Status Phase.

resolutions.for: No ships may tracerse the borders of this system during the next round of play. If this system gained over 10 votes more than any other system, the quarantine will take effect immediately (and last throughout the next round).
The player or players with the most victory points gain 1 victory point.
resolutions.against: The player or players with the fewest victory points gain 1 victory point.

resolutions.for: Remove the selected objective from the game and replace by a new Stage 1 Public Objective. Players whom have already claimed the replaced objective loses the associated number of victory points.
Place 1 Hit Counter on the elected Strategy Card. In order to select this card during Strategy Phase, the player must spend 5 influence.

The two borders with the most votes are now ipassable for units (place Hit-Counters to illustrate this). At the end of each round, a random player may move one of these effects to another border of choice.
resolutions.against: *Wormholes are not eligible.

resolutions.for: Players may discard three Action Cards to use the effects of a Sabotage card. During their turns, players may spend 8 resources of influence (or a mix thereof) to choose a discarded Action or Political card and add it to their hand.
resolutions.against: Discard this card.

resolutions.for: Starting with the Speaker, each player may place 1 free Ground Force on 1 uncontrolled (neutral) planet of his choice. Domain Counters are removed.
resolutions.against: Each controlled planet containing no units must either be exhausted or turned to neutral status.

resolutions.for: Each time a player acquires a Technology, he must either destroy two resources worth of his units or lose one Technology he held from before (removing a prerequisite Technology does not affect other Technologies).
resolutions.against: Playters must exhaust a planet (if able) for teach non-starting Technology he has.

resolutions.for: Technology Specialties have no effect. Technology Advances are purchased by spending influence instead of resources.
resolutions.against: Green and Yellow Technologies cannot be acquired for the remainder of this round.

resolutions.for: Give this card to the elected player. He immediately recieves 1 victory point. A player that wins an Invsaion Combat against this player immediately claims this card and recieves 1 victory point. If a player ever loses this card, he loses 1 victory point.
All Dreadnoughts and War Suns recieves -2 on all combat rolls.
resolutions.against: All players must choose and exhaust one of their planets for each Dreadnought and War Sun they have in play, if able.

resolutions.for: Each player may immediately gain one Dreadnough unit (for free) at one of his Space Docks
resolutions.against: The cost of each Cruiser, dreadnought and War Sun is increased by 2 resources for the remainder of this round.

resolutions.for: Each wormhole now has a blue technology specialty. At the end of each round, the player controlling more (non-D) wormholes than any other player gains 1 victory point; then players must destroy one of their non-Fighter ships in each fleet present with (non-D) wormholes.
resolutions.against: Wormholes may not be used for the remainder of the round.
